description: Dive into "Romantic Escapes in Enchanting Bristol" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Romantic Escapes in Enchanting Bristol

places.generalDescription: Escape Hunt Bristol offers a thrilling experience with four unique escape room themes. You can choose to escape from Blackbeard's cabin on a sinking pirate ship, help Doctor Who fix a tear in time, become an expert Mi6 agent in 1942, or travel to ancient Japan to steal a magic stone. Future Inn Bristol provides comfortable accommodation options including the romantic Superior King Room with added perks like free parking and Wi-Fi.

sources.snippet: Future Inn Bristol is an ideal base for the night, offering various bedroom types. Up the romance factor by booking a Superior King Room; the large bedroom comes with a King-sized bed and soft seating area, as well as all the perks you can expect from a stay at Future Inns, including car parking for £9 per night, free wifi and a complimentary robe and slippers.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Things for Couples to do in Bristol

sources.snippet: For more unusual date ideas in Bristol, Escape Hunt is perfect for an adrenaline-inducing afternoon with your boo. Immerse yourself in Blackbeard's Treasure, The Fourth Samurai and other fun themes, but act quick - you both have 60 minutes to crack the case.
sources.shortName: Fun Things To Do For Couples In Bristol

places.name: Escape Hunt Bristol

reviews.text: FAULTLESS. Visited with four friends, and we took on 'The Fourth Samurai' escape room, completing it in 52 minutes! We arrived 30 minutes early, and the lobby had a great selection of board games to keep us entertained while we waited. This experience was definitely one to check off my bucket list, and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a fun and challenging activity. The staff were exceptional, even accommodating an extra person in our booking at the last minute. Their top-notch customer service is no doubt why the ratings for this place are so high. A must-visit

We did the Eye of the Sun God hosted by Ethan - highly recommend! It was a very immersive and fun experience. The decorations, lighting together with the music were brilliant. I appreciate that the tasks were achievable but still challenging enough to make you think. Ethan was super friendly and helpful and made our experience very enjoyable. The perfect theme if you are a fan of Indiana Jones! :)

Eloise was our host for finest hour. She was a very believable MI5 agent from HQ and we had so much fun that we almost didn't want to leave the room. We saved the world and won the war - perhaps next time we will be samurais! Thank you Eloise!

places.address: Broadmead, Bristol, BS1 3BX, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: The Clifton Suspension Bridge, a stunning creation by Isambard Kingdom Brunel, elegantly stretches across a dramatic urban river gorge. This iconic structure not only showcases remarkable industrial design but also embodies the rich history of Bristol's engineering feats. My journey to understand this landmark began in 2010 when I explored the area with my camera in hand, eager to capture its essence.

sources.snippet: One of the city’s most iconic sights, you can’t go wrong if you’re looking for Bristol date spots or outdoor date ideas with WOW factor. Blessed with a stunning backdrop of rolling Mendip Hills and dramatic Avon Gorge cliffs, the stunning backdrop will definitely impress the object of your affections. My husband and I had only just met when, after a night out in Bristol, him, his friend and I, decided to carry on the fun and watch the sunrise at some ungodly hour over Clifton Suspension Bridge.
sources.shortName: Best Bristol date ideas

sources.snippet: Definitely one of the most famous structures in all of Bristol this iconic iron monster actually has a softer side, a romantic walk along the Clifton Suspension Bridge and up to the to the Clifton Observatory will not only offer up some of the most beautiful views of the Avon Gorge and the surrounding Bristol area but who wouldn’t enjoy a romantic stroll hand in hand?. And with the chilly weather still around you will have the perfect excuse to cuddle up with each other to enjoy the view.
sources.shortName: 10 Bristol Romantic Date Ideas

sources.snippet: No matter how hard you try, you won’t find a better view of the city than the one from the Clifton Suspension Bridge. This is the go-to spot to take a deep breath and admire the gorgeous surrounding scenery from up high, and enjoy each other’s company. Whether you choose to go in the day and enjoy an ice cream as you walk or at night, when the bridge is beautifully lit up, romance is guaranteed at this spot.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Things for Couples to do in Bristol

sources.snippet: The Clifton Suspension Bridge is Bristol’s most iconic landmark, a stunning piece of architecture spanning the picturesque Avon Gorge. It offers breathtaking views of the city and its surroundings, creating a romantic setting ideal for couples to take in the natural beauty together. Built in 1864, the bridge exudes historic charm, making it a symbol of engineering excellence and timeless romance.
sources.shortName: Romantic Escapes: 5 Best Things to Do in Bristol for Couples

sources.snippet: Spanning the Avon Gorge and River Avon, this bridge is synonymous with the city. There are so many romantic spots that offer stunning views of this iconic landmark for your special moment. Whether you check out the view from Leigh Woods, climb up to the Clifton Observatory or simply sit on the grassy banks nearby, the bridge will provide a brilliant backdrop for your all-important question.
sources.shortName: Where to propose in Bristol

sources.snippet: Take a series of beautiful pictures in the most romantic corners of the city: Bristol Harbor, Clifton Suspension Bridge, St. Mary Redcliffe Church, Watershed, Ashton Court Mansion, and Tyntesfield House. By hiring a local photographer, you will definitely find many unexpected and even secret photo spots that only locals know about.
sources.shortName: How to organize a romantic weekend in Bristol
12 Refreshingly Unique Bristol Date Ideas

places.name: Clifton Suspension Bridge

reviews.text: The views are breath taking. This is such a beautiful bridge and part of Bristol's culture. The structure of this bridge is amazing. The surrounding areas are beautiful. The Observatory is nearby. This is definitely worth a visit if you are in Bristol.

An absolutely amazing experience!
The nature and scenery were breathtaking, with stunning views that reminded me of the beautiful mountain landscapes from where I come from. The location is truly unique and worth visiting. There's a small toll for cars, but it's free if you walk – and walking across gives you a completely different, more enjoyable experience. Highly recommended!

This attraction is definitely worth a visit just for the breathtaking views across the valley. It's free to walk across unless your in a car that is and then you pay at the toll. Walking across did seem busy and you have to move with the traffic if people. There's lots of photo opportunitie here and when your thirsty after your walk across and back you can visit the nearby castle for refreshments.

places.address: Bristol, BS3 2JX, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Bristol, Bristol Cathedral is a stunning example of Gothic architecture with roots tracing back to the 12th century. Originally founded as an abbey, it transformed into the seat of the Bishop of Bristol following the dissolution of monasteries in the 1500s. This remarkable structure features a unique hall church design where its nave, aisles, and choir share equal height, creating an impressive visual experience.

sources.snippet: If you’re looking for a quiet place to spend a reflective day in Bristol, there’s no better location to do it than at Bristol Cathedral, which was consecrated in 1148 after its founding in 1140. Regarded as a Grade I listed structure by Historic England, the cathedral features long Gothic windows with a pinnacled skyline. Not only is it where you can pay respects, but it is also one of the most beautiful attractions in the city.
sources.shortName: 13 Best Romantic Things To Do In Bristol, England - Updated 2024

sources.snippet: Located on College Green, the 12th century-founded Bristol Cathedral makes for a picturesque stop-off, whether you want to chill out on the park outside or head inside for a free guided tour. As you take in the German-style hall-church, decorated Gothic style features and late Norman architecture, you can’t help but feel romantic in this historic, quaint atmosphere. Best for: Architecture fans
sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Bristol

sources.snippet: Explore the majestic Bristol Cathedral, marvel at Banksy's Well Hung Lover, and soak in panoramic views from Cabot Tower. Stroll hand in hand down the historic Christmas Steps, savor local delights at St Nicholas Market, and enjoy a cozy drink at the Llandoger Trow pub. Take in the elegant Queen Square and end your journey along the peaceful Harbourside.
sources.shortName: Romantic tour in Bristol - Evendo

sources.snippet: Get ready for a date with history at Bristol Cathedral, a must-see gem in the heart of the city!. Marvel at its stunning architecture and immerse yourselves in 900 years of captivating history on one of their guided tours. With daily openings and free admission, this is an essential stop on any Bristol trip.
sources.shortName: Love in the West: Unforgettable Date Ideas Bristol

places.name: Bristol Cathedral

reviews.text:
I recently had the pleasure of visiting Bristol Cathedral today, and I must say, it was an incredible experience. The moment I stepped inside, I was captivated by the grandeur and serene atmosphere of the cathedral.

Bristol Cathedral's stunning Gothic architecture left me in awe. The intricate details of the stained glass windows, the towering arches, and the beautifully crafted stonework perfectly showcased the cathedral's rich history and spiritual significance. Walking through its vast nave and observing the play of light filtering through the colorful windows was truly mesmerizing.

Although I could spend hours describing its beauty, what struck me the most was the peaceful ambiance, which provided a perfect space for reflection and admiration of the artistry that has stood the test of time.

I highly recommend a visit to Bristol Cathedral to anyone who appreciates history, architecture, and serene environments. It's definitely a must-see landmark when in Bristol.

Bristol Cathedral is a stunning blend of history, architecture, and serenity right on College Green. The architecture is stunning, especially the tall vaulted ceilings and stained glass windows. Admission is free, and guided tours are available for those interested in delving deeper into its rich history. Whether you're a history enthusiast, architecture lover, or seeking a quiet retreat, Bristol Cathedral is a must-visit.

The church is quite beautiful. While the majority of its current structure dates back to the Victorian era, its origins are significantly older. The gentleman stationed at the entrance was exceptionally kind and welcoming.

places.address: College Green, Bristol, BS1 5TJ, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Blaise Castle Estate, located near Henbury in Bristol, is a picturesque 18th-century estate featuring a decorative castle and a 19th-century house that now serves as an art museum. The estate spans 400 acres of parkland designed by Humphrey Repton, offering visitors the opportunity to escape the city and enjoy peaceful moments in nature.

sources.snippet: Just 15 minutes north of the city centre, Blaise Castle Estate features more than 400 acres of parkland to explore and one of the most romantic views in Bristol, Lover’s Leap. Blaise Hill has long been the site of important buildings; it was home to a fort during Roman times, St. Werburgh’s Chapel, St. Blaise Chapel, and finally Blaise Castle, which was built in 1766. Also on the grounds is Blaise House which was built at the beginning of the 19 th century.
sources.shortName: The Most Romantic Spots in Bristol

sources.snippet: Get ready for a day of exploration at Blaise Castle Estate, a 650-acre Grade II registered parkland packed with things to do!. Dive into history at Blaise Museum and step back in time to discover how people lived, what they wore, and even how they tackled household chores. Then, brace yourself for a 20-minute uphill hike to the enchanting ruins of Blaise Castle.
sources.shortName: Love in the West: Unforgettable Date Ideas Bristol

sources.snippet: Swap the busy city centre for a dreamy fairytale-like castle!. Why not find the perfect spot to get down on one knee during a romantic walk or pause for a picnic near this decorative folly?. This inspiring structure looks like a scene straight out of a storybook, so it’s sure to secure a ‘yes’ and your fairytale ending!
sources.shortName: Where to propose in Bristol

sources.snippet: Blaise Castle as a whole is pretty romantic, but the Lovers Leap viewing spot is spectacular. This dramatic precipice towers above the gorge and offers incredible views.
sources.shortName: The most romantic places in Bristol to take your date on Valentine's Day 2020
The most romantic places in Bristol to take your date…

places.name: Blaise Castle

reviews.text: Very nice place to let out some steam or go for a walk. 2 playgrounds a cafe and toilets it has everything you need. Places to find and explore my little one loved it. To top off the day the castle was opened to go in and have a look at the amazing views from the top.

Nice place to walk your dog with a nice cafe and play area for kids. My dog loves going for a swim in the dingle. The only thing I don't like is the fact they want you to pay for parking when it was free a few years ago!

Blaise Castle is a hidden gem in Bristol.

The stunning landscape and picturesque surroundings make it a perfect spot for a leisurely walk or a family picnic.

The castle itself is charming and steeped in history, offering a fascinating glimpse into the past.

The grounds are well-maintained, and there are plenty of trails to explore, making it a great place for both kids and adults. The views from the castle are breathtaking, especially on a clear day.

I also loved the nearby café, which has a lovely selection of snacks and drinks. The atmosphere is relaxed, and it's a great place to unwind after exploring the area.

Overall, I highly recommend visiting Blaise Castle if you're in Bristol. It's a wonderful blend of nature, history, and tranquility!

places.address: Kings Weston Rd, Bristol, BS10 7QS, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Ashton Court, a sprawling 850-acre estate in Bristol, is a beloved green space offering diverse terrain including fields and forests. Visitors can enjoy stunning views of the city and encounter a large herd of red and fallow deer. The estate also features a pitch and putt course for foot golf enthusiasts. Nearby attractions include the iconic Clifton Suspension Bridge with its breathtaking views of Avon Gorge, as well as Leigh Woods which offers excellent mountain bike trails.

sources.snippet: One of the best things about living in Bristol is the access to the gorgeous countryside around us, and even if you’re a real urbanite, it can be nice to ring the changes now and again. Ashton Court's sprawling estate is the ideal setting for couples craving a break from the urban hustle. Walk, cycle, or simply sit and enjoy the scenery together - it’s a breath of fresh air (quite literally) for your relationship, offering both the charm of ancient woodland and deer-grazed grasslands.
sources.shortName: 15+ Date Ideas in Bristol (You Actually Want To Do)
12 Refreshingly Unique Bristol Date Ideas

places.name: Ashton Court Estate

reviews.text: Lovely walk through the deer park on a cold winter day. Looks like it could take a day or two to explore the whole park thoroughly. Peaceful, not many folks on the (well-marked) trails. Public restroom was a welcome find, albeit in slightly poor condition.

Went there for an event. (Bristol Hot air balloon festival ) plenty of space for car parking ( previously arranged by the event organizers. Had a lots of fun. Family event friendly . Large outdoor space.

Lovely place. Lovely walks. Lovely coffee but over priced. Plenty to do.

There is a model ride on railway within the estate which is pretty impressive to go on. Especially the steam one.

places.address: Long Ashton, Bristol, BS41 9JN, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Bristol, the Bristol Museum & Art Gallery is a treasure trove for art and history enthusiasts alike. This cultural gem showcases an impressive collection that spans centuries and continents, featuring over 1,200 paintings and nearly 200 sculptures. Visitors can marvel at works from the Northern Renaissance to modern French art, alongside British masterpieces dating back to the 17th century.

sources.snippet: The Bristol Museum and Art Gallery, located on Queens Rd in the Clifton area of Bristol, is the perfect place to get lost and spend an afternoon wandering with your loved one. The museum and art gallery first opened almost 200 years ago, just down the street from its current location. Over the next 100 years, the museum moved around Park St sharing buildings with different societies, including the Literary and Philosophical Society and the Library Society, before moving to its current site.
sources.shortName: The Most Romantic Spots in Bristol

sources.snippet: Spend some time exploring the collections of art, nature and history on display. This unique location to propose is ideal for art and history buffs alike as there’s plenty to discover in the exhibitions. Plus, this incredible venue can be hired for weddings if you’d like to return to this memorable place.
sources.shortName: Where to propose in Bristol

sources.snippet: Heading to an art gallery or Bristol Museum has been the go-to date plan since… forever!. So luckily, Bristol has some of the best art spaces in the country. You and your significant other can spend your day hopping from gallery to gallery, discussing the brilliant work on display.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Things for Couples to do in Bristol

sources.snippet: Step into the magnificent Bristol Museum & Art Gallery and immerse yourself in a world of art, nature, and history, all under one exquisite roof!. Explore captivating collections that span billions of years of Earth’s history.
sources.shortName: Love in the West: Unforgettable Date Ideas Bristol

places.name: Bristol Museum & Art Gallery

reviews.text: When you enter the Bristol Museum, it's like you've stepped into another dimension, with regard to time, science and species of organisms both old and modern. Science section is so beautiful, then the photo gallery section too was amazing. What baffles my mind was the guy who keeps on climbing onto the ladder, reaches above and then drops down, picks himself up and drops again in different locations on the ground. Students learning about rocks and its mineral components  can learn a lot when the take a field trip there.

Bristol Museum: A Venue of Elegance
Stepping into the Bristol Museum for the Adobe function was a truly memorable experience. The building itself exudes a timeless elegance, with its grand architecture and meticulously crafted decor. It provided a stunning backdrop for the event, elevating the entire atmosphere. If you're looking for a venue that combines sophistication with a touch of history, the Bristol Museum is an absolute gem.

The gallery and museum offer a diverse collection appealing to a wide range of ages and preferences. While the building could benefit from some refurbishment, the overall experience is quite pleasant. Admission is complimentary.

places.address: Queens Rd, Clifton, Bristol BS8 1RL, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Bristol Hippodrome is a late-Victorian theater known for its retractable dome roof and a wide range of performances, including West End musicals, opera, and pantomime. The venue hosts top shows and stars from around the country, catering to audiences of all ages with child-friendly productions like Wicked, Matilda, and Diversity from Britain's Got Talent.

sources.snippet: One of the best attractions in Bristol is the famous Hippodrome theater, which showcases the best theatrical performances from all over the world. Apart from an annual pantomime, it is visited regularly by Welsh National Opera and also features shows from London’s West End. The grand theater is a great place to watch a production with your partner.
sources.shortName: 13 Best Romantic Things To Do In Bristol, England - Updated 2024

sources.snippet: Bristol is home to the famous Bristol Hippodrome Theatre, showcasing the best theatrical performances from around the world. The Bristol Old Vic is the UK's longest continuously-running theatre, celebrating 250 years of success. The Tobacco Factory offers unique shows and has an excellent market.
sources.shortName: Get Creative with these Date Night Ideas in Bristol

sources.snippet: If you like West End Musicals, you can go to the Bristol Hippodrome. This is one of the largest theater stages in the country, and you can see here lovely shows from London's West End. Doing so is one of the most romantic things to do in Bristol.
sources.shortName: 32 Romantic Things To Do in Bristol: Date Ideas in Bristol

sources.snippet: One of the most prestigious provincial theatres in the country, Bristol Hippodrome frequently features shows from London’s West End when they tour the UK, as well as an annual pantomime.
sources.shortName: Best Bristol date ideas

places.name: Bristol Hippodrome

reviews.text: Amazing theatre, makes me feel like I'm in London. The stalls seats are up a slope which is great for shorter people! Great view from both stalls and the circle, even at the back.

My very first theatre show and I was completely blown away. From the moment I stepped inside, the atmosphere was magical. The building itself is stunning, with a charming historic feel and a grand interior that sets the perfect stage for a night of theatre.

Moulin Rouge was everything I hoped it would be vibrant, emotional, and full of energy. The lighting, costumes, and set design were next-level, and the cast gave an unforgettable performance.

As a first time theatre-goer, this experience has set the bar incredibly high. If you've never been, I highly recommend catching a show at the Hippodrome. It's an experience you won't forget.

Although the view is good from all seats, there is very little leg room, barely enough to put your things, and the seats themselves are pretty narrow. There is also little space in the lobby and nowhere to get food- only small, commercial snacks like popcorn and a coffee. The que to enter the stalls usually extends outdoors due to how little space there is inside. The staff is also a bit hostile. The space is beautiful and pleasant to walk in, it is also well ventilated. I went to watch Shen Yun and was honestly a bit disappointed, both with the performance and the theatre.

places.address: St Augustine's Parade, Bristol, BS1 4UZ, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Nestled atop Brandon Hill, Cabot Tower stands as a remarkable 32-meter observation tower that commemorates the 400th anniversary of John Cabot's historic voyage to Newfoundland. Erected in 1897, this iconic structure not only pays homage to the famed explorer but also offers breathtaking panoramic views of Bristol’s skyline and its notable landmarks, including the majestic towers of Bristol Cathedral and St. Mary Redcliffe's spire.

sources.snippet: Not far from Bristol city centre, sandwiched between Clifton and Hotwells, Brandon Hill is the oldest municipal open space in the country and a convenient spot for a romantic walk taking in the picturesque Bristol skyline with the one you love. It first opened as a public park in the 1620s after being used as grazing space for nearly 500 years. Over the years, pathways and walls were added to the park making it more suitable for walking and running, and now it is also home to a popular play area for children.
sources.shortName: The Most Romantic Spots in Bristol

sources.snippet: As long as your date isn’t afraid of heights, this is a great activity to have up your sleeve. Cabot Tower was built to honour the 400th anniversary of John Cabot’s voyage from Bristol and subsequent ‘discovery’ of North America on The Matthew in 1497. It sits on top of view-tastic Brandon Hill, just off Park Street and is surrounded by parkland, landscaped gardens (another great romantic picnic spot) and Georgian houses.
sources.shortName: Best Bristol date ideas

sources.snippet: Explore the majestic Bristol Cathedral, marvel at Banksy's Well Hung Lover, and soak in panoramic views from Cabot Tower. Stroll hand in hand down the historic Christmas Steps, savor local delights at St Nicholas Market, and enjoy a cozy drink at the Llandoger Trow pub. Take in the elegant Queen Square and end your journey along the peaceful Harbourside.
sources.shortName: Romantic tour in Bristol - Evendo

sources.snippet: Cabot Tower is in the gorgeous parkland of Brandon Hill near Park Street in the West End. It was built in 1897 to commemorate John Cabot's famous voyage from Bristol to North America four hundred years earlier. It's free to climb up the steep, twisting steps of the tower, which is open daily.
sources.shortName: Get Creative with these Date Night Ideas in Bristol

sources.snippet: Located in Brandon Hill, this Neo-Gothic tower offers incredible views of the city thanks to its public viewing platform. The tower is located in Brandon Hill Park, located just off the popular shopping area, Park Street. The green space is ideal for a picnic to celebrate afterwards, too!
sources.shortName: Where to propose in Bristol

sources.snippet: One of the most romantic things to do in Bristol is going to the Cabot Tower. This is a very large tower that you can find a bit outside of the city center. You can find the tower in Hilly Park.
sources.shortName: 32 Romantic Things To Do in Bristol: Date Ideas in Bristol

sources.snippet: Make sure your date is prepared as Cabot Tower has quite a long and narrow staircase. If steps are no bother then the view at the top will make up for getting a little sweaty and out of breath.
sources.shortName: Date Ideas in Bristol | 2025 Guide

places.name: Cabot Tower

reviews.text:
Cabot Tower is a great visual visit attraction giving the visitor a 360 view of Bristol. Can you find the Marriott hotel, the church, or the university?
You should be able to navigate a winding, narrow staircase up and down to visit this attraction. The view is worth the climb up to the tower and then the stairs.
Want to make a romantic gestöbert proposal? Also a good place for something private on an off day.
Pick a sunny day as rain and clouds obscure the view. I know…we are speaking of England ;-)
Hope you enjoy it!

Cabot Tower is a hidden gem in Bristol that offers stunning panoramic views of the city. Nestled in Brandon Hill Park, the climb up is well worth the effort. The spiral staircase inside the tower is a bit narrow, but once you reach the top, you're rewarded with breathtaking sights of the harbourside, Clifton Suspension Bridge, and the city skyline.

The surrounding park is also a great place to relax, have a picnic, or take a scenic walk. Best of all, it's completely free to visit! If you're in Bristol, Cabot Tower is definitely a must-see spot.

Today, I had the pleasure of visiting Cabot Tower in Bristol, and it was truly a remarkable experience. The tower itself is a beautiful historic structure, offering a unique glimpse into the city's past. Built in 1897 to commemorate John Cabot's voyage from Bristol to North America, the tower stands as an iconic landmark in the heart of the city.

Climbing up the narrow spiral staircase was an adventure in itself, but the effort was well worth it. Upon reaching the top, I was greeted with breathtaking 360-degree views of Bristol. The panoramic scenery was absolutely stunning, showcasing different parts of this vibrant city from every angle. The picturesque landscapes, combined with the tower's historical charm, made for an unforgettable visit.

If you're ever in Bristol, I highly recommend stopping by Cabot Tower. It's a perfect spot to appreciate both the history and the beauty of the city.

places.address: Brandon Hill Park, Park St, Bristol, BS1 5RR, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Ashton Court Estate, located just a short drive from Bristol city center, is an expansive 850-acre country estate offering a variety of attractions. Visitors can explore the deer park, play areas, golf courses, and beautiful gardens on the sprawling grounds. The estate is also home to the impressive Ashton Court Mansion, showcasing stunning 16th-century architecture. With its diverse landscapes and picturesque views of Bristol, Ashton Court Estate provides a versatile location for various activities including filming scenes in natural or historical settings.

sources.snippet: Escape to the idyllic Ashton Court Estate, a picturesque country park and mansion spanning 850 acres of woodland and a deer park. With two charming cafes onsite, it’s the ideal setting for a romantic summer picnic. Please note that while admission is typically free, entry to certain parts of the estate may require payment during special events.
sources.shortName: Love in the West: Unforgettable Date Ideas Bristol

sources.snippet: In the west of the city sits Ashton Court Estate, a Victorian mansion set amid gorgeous landscaped grounds. As you and your partner stroll around some of the 850 acres of parkland and grassland, keep an eye out for deer!. The mansion itself is now an arts venue, and there’s also a Victorian-themed cafe in the stables courtyard.
sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Bristol

places.name: Ashton Court Estate

reviews.text: Lovely walk through the deer park on a cold winter day. Looks like it could take a day or two to explore the whole park thoroughly. Peaceful, not many folks on the (well-marked) trails. Public restroom was a welcome find, albeit in slightly poor condition.

Lovely place. Lovely walks. Lovely coffee but over priced. Plenty to do.

There is a model ride on railway within the estate which is pretty impressive to go on. Especially the steam one.
Beautiful place for cycling and walking… The deer sanctuary area is just beauty to your eyes… Must visit for some fresh air…

places.address: Long Ashton, Bristol, BS41 9JN, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Bristol Zoo Project, located just a 25-minute drive from the city center, offers visitors a chance to explore 50 acres of natural beauty. The park features woodlands, gardens, and the tranquil Tower Meadow for picnics. It is home to animals from Madagascar, East Africa, and the Congo. The zoo also hosts expert talks on various animals and plants and offers attractions for kids such as the Fun Fort, Barefoot Trail, and Butterfly Maze.

sources.snippet: Why not have fun and monkey about with your partner at Bristol Zoo and Gardens who have their ‘cheap’ romance offer on for Valentine’s Day weekend. Just like you and your partner you can wonder round looking at the equally loved up animals and when you are finished there then you can move on to the beautiful gardens.
sources.shortName: 10 Bristol Romantic Date Ideas

sources.snippet: Experience nature and take your partner out on a wild day at the Bristol Zoo Project. Here you can meet amazing animals from across the world. Including bears, giraffes, cheetahs, lemurs and more.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Things for Couples to do in Bristol

places.name: Bristol Zoo Project

reviews.text: I had a lovely day here. There's a lot of space for the animals and it's nice that they are able to roam around. There's not as big a selection of animals, but there are still plenty there to see. We got lucky and managed to see all the animals. There's still work in progress, and there's some work under construction. The highlight for me was seeing the giraffes. One of the giraffes was really close. It was amazing to see. The bear woods was good too, as we managed to see the bears come out at the perfect time. We got ice cream at the end, which was delicious. I had a really nice day here at the zoo. I'd highly recommend it for a day out.

Took our 3 kids (all 4 and under) for the day. Staff were really welcoming and they had 'Andy's adventure' theme with lots of extra bits around the park. These were hosted by staff and really clever and fun for the kids. The theme ran across the whole park and there were some really clever bits the kids got to be involved with. There are still some areas of the park under construction but there is still plenty to see and explore. You can definitely see the vision and it will be a great zoo over the next few years.
There were some lovely play parks and  climbing bits for the kids. Not many animals but this will increase. The animals they did have were in some great enclosures with easy visibility and unique viewing points. The bear walk was lovely and memorable! Paths were lined with blackberry bushes which felt really natural and aided in the wildlife support. Lots of fun signs and interesting bits for the kids to see along the way. My kids loved the maze too. We had a lovely day out and will return again see what changes and animals are there. It has been cleverly thought out and designed perfectly for both visitors and animals/wildlife.

Nice little zoo, aimed at younger children. Lots of walking around to the different exhibits. We looked at everything at a leisurely pace with several drinks and food stops in under six hours. The site is expanding. Hopefully they will also build more toilets - the current lack of being really my only criticism. Probably best visited when the weather is half decent.

places.address: Zoo Project, Blackhorse Hill, Bristol BS10 7TP, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Bravas is a cozy tapas bar in Redland, offering classic Spanish small plates in an intimate setting. The owners are committed to authenticity, with regular staff trips to Spain inspiring their traditional tapas dishes. The place is usually packed every evening, except on Sundays when it's closed. However, it opens at midday and runs until midnight for the remaining six days of the week.

sources.snippet: Small, bustling and energetic – you’ll probably have to book but a seat up at the bar in Bravas is a great place not just for eating and drinking, but for watching the busy goings-on in the kitchen. Try the fried aubergine with molasses and their grilled Iberico pork, washed down with one of their fantabulous G&Ts, then thank me later. If you don’t manage to get a booking, Bar 44 in Clifton is also lush and is much bigger so usually has space!
sources.shortName: Bristol’s Best Date Locations

sources.snippet: Bravas is the best blend of an intimate, romantic atmosphere and amazing food. Bravas does some of the best tapas and small plates in Bristol. A particular highlight of theirs is that they visit Spain frequently to bring truly local Spanish ideas back to the UK.
sources.shortName: The most romantic date spots in Bristol

sources.snippet: This small, softly-lit tapas bar on Cotham Hill is perfect for a romantic evening, as it only seats a handful of people. You can sit around the bar and watch the chefs in action, which is sure to be a great conversation starter.
sources.shortName: The most romantic places in Bristol to take your date on Valentine's Day 2020
The most romantic places in Bristol to take your date…

places.name: Bravas

reviews.text: Went today for the first time and had an amazing experience.  Staff are so friendly and helpful and willing to recommend food to us. The food is amazing, delicious with high quality.  Definitely will go again.

Brownie points to my date, who picked this place for a pre-movie supper. Warm and friendly service from Flo and the team, all of whom are super knowledgeable about the menu, which is changed daily. Imaginative and beautifully created dishes with an exceptional selection for vegetarian and gluten-free (I'm both). Cosy and intimate. Fancy expanding to Cheltenham?!

Brought my parents here, they absolutely loved it! The hake and pulled pork being their favourites. The service was also amazing, our server was so helpful in giving recommendations. The music was a touch loud but other than that it was perfect.

places.address: 7 Cotham Hill, Redland, Bristol BS6 6LD, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Clifton Observatory, a historic windmill dating back to 1766, has been repurposed into a unique rooftop bar with an observation tower that offers breathtaking views of the Clifton Suspension Bridge and the River Avon. This Grade II listed building also features a working 19th-century Camera Obscura at its top and Giants Cave, accessible via 130 rock-cut steps.

sources.snippet: Next up, one of the most classic Bristol date ideas: a trip to Clifton Observatory. We know what you’re thinking: every Bristolian has been here a million times before - but there’s more than one good reason to make it your next date venue. Unlike the time you headed there with your mates or to see the incredible Bristol Balloon Fiesta, you’ll be walking here maybe hand-in-hand with your partner to see nature’s most spectacular show.
sources.shortName: 15+ Date Ideas in Bristol (You Actually Want To Do)

sources.snippet: Clifton Observatory is the perfect place to spend an afternoon enjoying some of the most breathtaking views in the city with your love. The historic windmill was first built in 1766 before burning down twice and being converted to an observatory in 1828. From there, the observatory was used as a variety of venues, including a communications and patrol base and an air-raid shelter.
sources.shortName: The Most Romantic Spots in Bristol

sources.snippet: With such a beautiful city offering plenty of mesmerizing sights like Bristol, it’s no wonder that a place like Clifton Observatory exists. Formerly a mill established in 1766, it is now regarded as a Grade II structure by Historic England. The viewing platform does not disappoint with its scenic vista, giving views of the Clifton Suspension Bridge and the city of Bristol itself.
sources.shortName: 13 Best Romantic Things To Do In Bristol, England - Updated 2024

sources.snippet: If you’d rather something a bit fancier, but with the same colossal Clifton Suspension Bridge views, Clifton Observatory 360 Bar and Rooftop terrace overlooks Brunel’s Avon Gorge-spanning landmark. Watching the sun set from this vantage point, tipple in hand, on a balmy summer’s eve, doesn’t get much dreamier.
sources.shortName: Best Bristol date ideas

sources.snippet: Whether you check out the view from Leigh Woods, climb up to the Clifton Observatory or simply sit on the grassy banks nearby, the bridge will provide a brilliant backdrop for your all-important question.
sources.shortName: Where to propose in Bristol

places.name: Clifton Observatory

reviews.text: If you have no plans for a bank holiday weekend, this is the perfect little day activity. The museum was great, and I thoroughly enjoyed the Camera Obscura. The Giant's Cave is a great adventure, and the views are brilliant. Definitely needed a hard hat as I would have hit my head multiple times if not

Nice little attraction next to the Clifton Suspension Bridge. The area in front of the observatory is probably the best for views of the bridge, particularly from the hill itself. There's a statue of Wallace from Wallace and Gromit just outside that bears a resemblance to Brunel which is cool, as a part of a trail on at the moment.

The observatory tower was a little bit disappointing as it isn't open air - there are windows, a few of which open although I'm not sure if they're supposed to, with a cool but incredibly warm camera obscura at the top. Not the best views of the bridge to be honest, I preferred from underneath the observatory, in the caves.

The caves were really good - a bit narrow and hard to pass people coming the opposite way, and I did hit my head a couple of times which was a pain. Some parts have uneven surfaces, but it's understandable as it's literally a cave. The views are great, with netting and a fence blocking them a bit but big enough to fit a camera through. The viewing area has a metal but see-through floor which I can understand a lot of people not liking very much, although there's plenty of hard floor behind it if you don't.

Overall, good but not the best. It's only a fiver though for both areas so pretty worth it for the price. There's also a restaurant with open air views but I don't venture up there.

This is such a beautiful place to visit with great views of the city and suspension bridge. The cafe serves some delicious drinks and bakery items too 😋

I had my wedding here and it was an amazing day!

places.address: Litfield Place, Clifton, Bristol BS8 3LT, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Bristol, the Bristol Old Vic stands as a testament to theatrical history, being the oldest working theater in England. This beautifully restored Georgian venue combines classic red-and-gold decor with cutting-edge technology, creating an inviting atmosphere for all who enter. Since its inception in 1766, it has been a hub for captivating performances, often showcasing timeless works like those of Shakespeare.

sources.snippet: One for our artsy theatre readers, Bristol Old Vic Bar & Kitchen serves a great range of local draught beers and ciders, West Country spirits and an extensive whisky range. For a fun and intimate Valentine’s evening, we recommend heading over to the Old Vic bar, and maybe even enjoying one of the Pieminister Pies, before enjoying a live performance in the stunning theatre. With the bar open until late, you could even carry the night on post-theatre show!
sources.shortName: Bristol’s most romantic spots for Valentine’s Day

sources.snippet: The Bristol Old Vic is the UK's longest continuously-running theatre, celebrating 250 years of success. The Tobacco Factory offers unique shows and has an excellent market. Whatever your date's taste in live entertainment, Bristol is sure to deliver.
sources.shortName: Get Creative with these Date Night Ideas in Bristol

sources.snippet: Bristol Old Vic is the oldest continuously-working theatre in the English speaking world. Expect pioneering 21st century theatre inspired by the history and magical design of the beautiful playhouse. Onsite bar and restaurant.
sources.shortName: Best Bristol date ideas

sources.snippet: Bristol Old Vic is a very old theater that is amazing to visit. In fact, it is one of the oldest English-speaking world theaters there is. You can see here all kinds of shows together with your significant other.
sources.shortName: 32 Romantic Things To Do in Bristol: Date Ideas in Bristol

places.name: Bristol Old Vic

reviews.text:
Went and saw 'show stoppers the musical'
The show was total improvisation from start to finish and it was absolutely brilliant. I didn't know what to expect but I'm so glad I went. It was so funny. The cast are so talented.
The old Vic was a great theatre. We had seats at the top, there were lots of stairs to walk up but a very historic theatre.

My friend and I popped into the Bristol Old Vic for a drink..what a beautiful building. I've never seen a show here before, but I'd love to come back to see inside the theatre rooms. Lovely staff, very friendly with quick service.
Great day out exploring Bristol and enjoying a play at a very quirky theatre, fantastic mix of modern and old , stunning seating we  will definitely return for another play !

places.address: King St, Bristol, BS1 4ED, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: The Ivy Clifton Brasserie offers a sophisticated and stylish dining experience with its vintage-inspired decor, large windows, and classic brasserie menu. Located in Clifton Village overlooking The Mall Gardens, this chic restaurant features elegant brass chandeliers, Art Deco details, and comfortable banquettes for guests to enjoy their tea or champagne. As part of the Ivy Collection, the restaurant boasts colorful art-deco interiors and a menu that draws inspiration from global cuisine.

sources.snippet: Sophistication is what comes to mind when visiting The Ivy Clifton Brasserie – another venue that is sure to impress your date on Valentine’s Day. With welcoming staff that cannot do enough for you, and situated right opposite The Mall Gardens, this a gorgeous place for either Champagne brunch, or a romantic evening meal.
sources.shortName: Bristol’s most romantic spots for Valentine’s Day

sources.snippet: Wind your way through gorgeous Georgian houses to tuck into poolside tapas at The Lido, or enjoy some elevated Spanish dishes in the beautiful surrounds of Bar 44.
sources.shortName: Romantic Places to Eat & Drink in Bristol

places.name: The Ivy Clifton Brasserie

reviews.text:
Our experience at The Ivy Clifton Brasserie was absolutely fantastic! From the moment we walked in, we were impressed by the elegant and beautifully designed interior, with its stylish décor and charming atmosphere. The attention to detail in both the furnishings and the artwork really added to the overall experience.

The food was delicious, perfectly prepared and beautifully presented. The menu offers a great selection, and everything we tried was full of flavor and cooked to perfection. The service was outstanding-the staff were incredibly friendly, professional, and attentive, making sure we had everything we needed without being intrusive.

Another highlight was the spotlessly clean and wonderfully fresh-smelling restrooms, which only added to the overall sense of quality and attention to detail.

It was a truly enjoyable dining experience, and we highly recommend The Ivy Clifton Brasserie for anyone looking for great food, excellent service, and a lovely ambiance. ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

Went for afternoon tea and the place is amazing for it! The atmosphere is delightful, the staff were pleasant, although communication was a little lacking. We ended up repeating our order multiple times, waiting for things to arrive, only to be needing to ask again.

But all in all the afternoon tea selection was a good amount and filling, and also delicious! We definitely enjoyed ourselves.

I enjoyed a wedding reception in the private dining room at the Ivy in Bristol. The staff were wonderfully warm and attentive, in particular Elsa, who looked after the entire wedding party all evening. The food was exceptional - In particular, I had blackened cod, which was cooked perfectly.

places.address: 42-44 Caledonia Pl, Clifton, Bristol BS8 4DN, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Castle Park is a delightful green oasis nestled in the heart of Bristol, perfectly positioned between the bustling Shopping Quarter and the serene floating harbor along the River Avon. This park is not just a place to unwind; it’s steeped in history, featuring remnants of Bristol Castle and two churches that were tragically affected during World War II. Visitors can explore its charming flower gardens, which add vibrant colors to this urban retreat.

sources.snippet: Warm spring and summer days are perfect for picnics in the parks of Bristol, which has tons of choices when it comes to picnicking spots. What’s more, these locations make for great date ideas, a welcome change in today’s world where dates are mostly done in high-end restaurants and lounges. Castle Park is one of the most beautiful verdant spaces in Bristol, with grassy areas, silver birch trees, a sensory herb garden, and ruins of Bristol Castle and St. Peter’s Church.
sources.shortName: 13 Best Romantic Things To Do In Bristol, England - Updated 2024

sources.snippet: Castle Park is a great park that you can find in the city center of Bristol. It is a large park that is perfect if you want to have a romantic walk together. The site of the park used to be the main shopping area of the city before World War II destroyed the place.
sources.shortName: 32 Romantic Things To Do in Bristol: Date Ideas in Bristol

places.name: Castle Park

reviews.text: Nice little park right in the centre of town. Ni e river views too. Great place to relax on a sunny day.

Castle Park (containing St Peter's Church and some other small memorials) has an overwhelming and consistent smell of weed mixed with urine which is not nice is. It is also home to many tents and lots of empty alcohol bottles and tins.
Certainly wouldn't like to walk through there at night, but on a sunny autumnal day it was quite pleasant, smell aside.
You cannot enter the church but you can wander around the outside within the park. An offshoot of the River Avon flanks its southern border.
Entering the park via Castle Bridge (pedestrian) is lovely.

A lovely green escape nestled right in the heart of the city, blending urban life with riverside calm. With its wide open lawns, historic church ruins, and views along the Floating Harbour, it's a popular spot for picnics, casual strolls, and catching up with friends. The park has a rich history, once the site of a medieval castle and remnants of St Peter's Church still stand as a quiet memorial to the city's past. Whether you're grabbing lunch from nearby cafés or just soaking up the sun on a warm afternoon and offers a peaceful retreat just minutes from the buzz of Broadmead and Cabot Circus.

places.address: Broad Weir, Bristol, BS1 3XB, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: St Mary Redcliffe Church is a stunning 15th-century landmark that stands as a testament to Bristol's rich architectural heritage. Renowned for its impressive Perpendicular Gothic design, this church has survived the ravages of time and war, making it one of England's most celebrated parish churches. Originally built in the 13th century and later renovated, it features exquisite details such as slender clustered pillars and intricate vaulting that reflect the prosperity of Bristol’s merchants.

sources.snippet: Let’s journey through time together at St Mary Redcliffe Church, a breathtaking masterpiece of Gothic architecture dating back 800 years!. Join one of their free guided tours and explore why Queen Elizabeth I once called it “The goodliest and most famous parish church in England.” It’s a perfect blend of romance and history for an unforgettable date!
sources.shortName: Love in the West: Unforgettable Date Ideas Bristol

sources.snippet: Take a series of beautiful pictures in the most romantic corners of the city: Bristol Harbor, Clifton Suspension Bridge, St. Mary Redcliffe Church, Watershed, Ashton Court Mansion, and Tyntesfield House. By hiring a local photographer, you will definitely find many unexpected and even secret photo spots that only locals know about.
sources.shortName: How to organize a romantic weekend in Bristol

places.name: St Mary Redcliffe Church

reviews.text: An amazing well maintained church, free entry. So many beautiful stained glass windows on every side. The organist was playing while I was there which showed off the amazing acoustics. Well worth a visit, make a donation after your visit.
St Mary Redcliffe is a gem of Gothic architecture in the heart of Bristol. It is not just a temple, but a work of art, astonishing in its scale, stained glass windows and elegance of stone carvings.

Beautiful church nestled in the heart of Bristol, well worth your time if you're walking by this place. The gardens are well maintained and there's plenty of material in the church itself to guide you through a visit.

places.address: The Parish Office, 12 Colston Parade, Redcliffe, Bristol BS1 6RA, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Flight Club Bristol offers a fresh take on the traditional game of darts, turning it into a fun and sociable experience. With various game options available, it's suitable for both beginners and experts. The venue boasts quirky decor and serves excellent cocktails, providing the perfect setting for a night out with friends or a unique date. In addition to electronic darts, Flight Club also hosts weekend brunch socials featuring bottomless Prosecco and pizza after a taster game of Social Darts.

sources.snippet: For fun activities that will get you laughing and chatting on your date, head to Flight Club. This interactive darts tournament has different game options – so you don't have to be an expert. The décor is super quirky, and they have excellent cocktails, so you can stay at the bar and chat after the games are over.
sources.shortName: Get Creative with these Date Night Ideas in Bristol

sources.snippet: At this quirky bar decked out with carnival and fairground decor, you can play a jazzed-up version of social darts, sip on delicious signature cocktails and chow down on wood-fired pizzas like four cheese and BBQ roasted chicken.
sources.shortName: Fun Things To Do For Couples In Bristol

places.name: Flight Club Bristol

reviews.text: Fab place for groups; brilliant atmosphere. Nacho's were great to nibble on between throws. I thought beers were a little expensive until I realised that a service charge was automatically added. When we paid the tab at the end the card machine was set up to add ANOTHER tip though - please be aware of this. I'd actually left a cash tip on the counter originally so could have ended up paying 3 separate tips! Other than that it was a very enjoyable visit and I'd recommend.
Very friendly staff, good food, loved their lemonade, even their bathroom looks like a maze but very well maintained and clean. What a great place to hang out with friends and play dart 🎯 Loved it.

Flight Club is such a great group outing - great cocktails and sharing plates as well.

We ordered two HUGE pizzas and their new summer ‘in bloom' cocktails are super juicy, refreshing and pretty 😍

I loved the Just Peachy and, surprisingly, as I don't reallly like aperol, I enjoyed the Amalfi Nights. Both were summertime in a glass 🍹

Follow me on Instagram for more food reviews: @hungry_hesketh

places.address: 41 Corn St, Bristol, BS1 1HT, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the vibrant heart of Bristol's theater district, Smoke & Mirrors is a captivating pub that seamlessly blends the allure of magic with a lively atmosphere. This intimate venue features its very own 'Magic Theatre,' where you can catch live performances from talented magicians on weekends. If you're looking for an unforgettable night out, this spot offers a delightful two-hour comedy magic show that promises to keep you and your partner entertained with laughter and awe.

sources.snippet: If you and your partner enjoy watching comedy shows, then head over to this fantastic two-hour comedy magic show at Smoke & Mirrors, where two house magicians will keep you laughing and entertained all night long. Located in the heart of the theater district in Bristol, Smoke & Mirrors is known to serve the best ales, fine wines, and stonebaked pizzas. You and your companion will surely have a fun night out with amazing drinks, comedy gold, and completely enthralling and enchanting magic.
sources.shortName: 13 Best Romantic Things To Do In Bristol, England - Updated 2024

sources.snippet: If you’re looking for Bristol date ideas that add a touch of “magic”, this one’s for you. Standing outside of Smoke and Mirrors on Denmark Street, you’d never guess that this was anything other than a cosy pub. Step inside, however, and you’d realise you’ve already been taken in by magical illusion number one!
sources.shortName: 15+ Date Ideas in Bristol (You Actually Want To Do)

sources.snippet: A great place for indoor date ideas in Bristol, Smoke & Mirrors is a fabulous theatre bar serving up a range of magic, music and comedy performances to suit all tastes. Rally your partner and prepare for an evening that'll leave you either amazed, impressed or laughing.
sources.shortName: Fun Things To Do For Couples In Bristol

places.name: Smoke & Mirrors

reviews.text: We had an incredible evening at Smoke & Mirrors in Bristol. The atmosphere was cosy and lively, creating the perfect setting for an evening of entertainment. The magic show was outstanding-full of jaw-dropping tricks, great humour, and real personality. You can really see the passion and skill of the performers. The staff were fantastic too-so friendly, welcoming, and attentive throughout the night. It was such a memorable experience, and we're already looking forward to coming back. A must-visit if you're in Bristol.

First time in Bristol, first time at Smoke & Mirrors! and what a show! Absolutely worth the trip. Without a doubt the best magic show I've seen in the UK. The atmosphere was electric, the venue intimate and fun, and the performers were top-tier.

The highlight of the night was definitely Jaie, mind-blowing performance! I still can't figure out how he did what he did. Truly unforgettable. If you're anywhere near Bristol, don't miss this show.

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
If you're looking for a night of pure wizardry and giggles in Bristol, this is THE place! Mark and Richard aren't just magicians – they're part-time comedians, full-time mind-blowers. Honestly, I'm still trying to figure out how Mark made my jaw disappear for half the night (spoiler: it was from laughing too much).

Mark was the perfect entertainer- warm, welcoming, and hilariously cheeky, making just the right amount of fun of everyone (don't worry, it's all in good spirits… unless he actually is a wizard, in which case, RIP my dignity).

The show was super interactive, so no chance of dozing off – unless you were hypnotized, which I'm still not ruling out. The magic itself? Brilliant. Real “how-did-they-do-that?!” moments that left us all questioning reality and Googling “how to become a magician” on the way home.

If you want a quirky, laugh-out-loud night out in Bristol that's totally different from the usual pub crawl, go see these guys. Just don't ask them to pull a rabbit out of a hat – they're too busy pulling smiles out of thin air! 🪄✨

places.address: 8 Denmark St, Bristol, BS1 5DQ, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Bristol Aquarium is a popular family attraction located in the heart of the city, offering an exciting underwater adventure. Visitors can explore eight permanent exhibits, including the Sunken Shipwreck, Bay of Rays, and Urban Jungle Botanical House. The aquarium houses a diverse range of sea creatures in both tropical and native environments, from sharks to sea bass. Additionally, it features a giant octopus and Amazonian fish in large tanks with underwater tunnels.

sources.snippet: If giant octopuses and sharks are your thing, then an offbeat but fantastic date idea in Bristol is wandering around Bristol Aquarium together. The aquarium is home to a host of usual and unusual marine life, including piranhas, pufferfish, seahorses, stingrays, and Amazonian fish, among others. However, what’s really cool about this place are the deck chairs in the greenhouse.
sources.shortName: 13 Best Romantic Things To Do In Bristol, England - Updated 2024

sources.snippet: Take a trip to the Harbourside area of the city to dive into this aquarium. Home to thousands of aquatic animals from across the world, there are over 40 displays to spot everything from tropical sharks and seahorses to puffer fish. Ask for your loved one’s hand in the underwater tunnel as the colourful marine life swims over your heads!
sources.shortName: Where to propose in Bristol

sources.snippet: Discover thousands of aquatic creatures, from tropical sharks and graceful rays to mesmerising seahorses and colourful puffer fish. Adult tickets start from £20.50 🐠
sources.shortName: Love in the West: Unforgettable Date Ideas Bristol

places.name: Bristol Aquarium

reviews.text: A great place to visit whilst in Bristol! We arrived first thing, before there was any crows so was able to spend time at each of the tanks and displays. Plenty to see and enjoy, including the talks which were informative and engaging. Loved the fact we could pop out for some lunch and come back in on the same ticket. We spent over four hours here and felt the tickets were great value for money. Would definitely recommend.

Was smaller then thought but there was still a lot to look at. Helpful how you can leave and enter on the same ticket so great if children get restless.  Talks throughout the day were engaging and allowed to q&a. Very informative. We went for my son's 1st birthday and was a good couple of hours out.

Had a good time at the aquarium! It wasn't too crowded (except at the Octopus talk - which was otherwise fab!) and there was many interesting fish and underwater creatures. However, I have been to better and bigger aquariums, so about £42 for two adults felt a little steep for about 1.5h - we went slow and took our time looking at all the fish.

places.address: Anchor Rd, Bristol, BS1 5TT, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Lido is a Victorian building in Bristol that houses an exclusive open-air pool and a glass-fronted poolside restaurant. The city also has its own currency called Bristol Pounds, which can be used to support local businesses. St Andrews, one of the city's beautiful parks, features a playground for children and a free paddling pool for families to enjoy during the summer.

sources.snippet: Fantastic food matched with a special venue – if you’re feeling keen maybe you could suggest a spa day with your loved one before you head to the restaurant to perk up your energy levels (you can get a package to combine the two if you like). The restaurant overlooks the outdoor pool which is lovely, and the menu is great whether you’re going for breakfast, some snacky tapas or their a la carte menu.
sources.shortName: Bristol’s Best Date Locations

sources.snippet: A romantic weekend is a good excuse to spend a relaxing evening for two at the spa: Ton Poh Thai Spa and Wellness, Lido Spa, Holistic Therapy Clinic, Bristol Float Center, Bannatyne Health Club & Spa - all these places will give you a feeling of relaxation and peace. Spa treatments will bring your body into a state of balance, quickly achieving both deep relaxation and an intense influx of vitality.
sources.shortName: How to organize a romantic weekend in Bristol

sources.snippet: If you’re looking for a relaxing and romantic escape from the city without actually having to leave the city, the Bristol Lido is the perfect place to spend a day. The Lido first opened in 1850 and was a popular place for Bristolians to visit for more than a hundred years. Unfortunately, by the end of the 20 th century, the pool needed a lot of repairs and was closed to the public.
sources.shortName: The Most Romantic Spots in Bristol

sources.snippet: The bar at the Clifton Lido accompanies its reopened pool and spa complex (it lay derelict until 2008). Originally built in 1849, it’s an historic and picturesque location beautiful redesigned. Its bar and restaurant offer great views over the pool, so why not break with tradition and combine a romantic drink with a swim, a dinner, and maybe even a couples massage?
sources.shortName: Bristol’s Hidden Gems: Romantic Bars

sources.snippet: Another restaurant with an interesting view is the Bristol Lido Restaurant - which as you'd expect overlooks the Lido so you can watch energetic people swimming while you enjoy the culinary delights on offer. Why not try their "Birdfood" tasting menu and try some of everything?. http://www.lidobristol.com/restaurant/
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do In Bristol on AboutBritain.com

sources.snippet: Bristol Lido features a glass-fronted restaurant overlooking an open-air pool. It’s an urban oasis that offers steam, sauna and hot tub facilities. Bristol Lido has a ‘swim and eat’ package which allows you to take a dip with your date and enjoy a two course a la carte lunch too.
sources.shortName: Date Ideas in Bristol | 2025 Guide
12 Refreshingly Unique Bristol Date Ideas

sources.snippet: Wind your way through gorgeous Georgian houses to tuck into poolside tapas at The Lido, or enjoy some elevated Spanish dishes in the beautiful surrounds of Bar 44.
sources.shortName: Romantic Places to Eat & Drink in Bristol
Where to propose in Bristol

places.name: Bristol Lido

reviews.text: Had a gorgeous meal and swim packages here and the food was delightful. Would definitely recommend for a special occasion. The facilities were clean& well done- not too busy on a weekday evening but has perfect atmosphere! Heather was a great server too!!!

Booked an afternoon swim session here and had a fantastic time.
Swimming pool and plenty of room to swim, really nice chilled vibe too. I loved the sauna and steam room followed by the cold water bucket, certainly felt refreshing.
Hot tub was really busy but I managed to squeeze in for five minutes.
Towel hire is worth it for £3 because you can get a fresh towel as many times as you want, very useful.
Shower rooms were clean and had lovely shower gel and shampoo.
Will definitely be back for one of the food and swim packages, especially when the weather gets warmer.

Originally saw this place featured on a tv show years ago & always wanted to go but never got the chance. This weekend I got to go twice & it didn't disappoint. This place has such a cool vibe! Food was excellent, fresh & delicious. Service was efficient, easy going & very friendly. Can't wait to go back! This place gets a five star review from me!

places.address: Oakfield Pl, Clifton, Bristol BS8 2BJ, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Nestled in suburban Westbury Park, Littlefrench is a charming, family-owned restaurant that has garnered praise from critics for its seasonal French-inspired menu and inviting courtyard seating. The ambiance seamlessly blends Parisian elegance with the rustic charm of the Dordogne region. Guests are welcomed by a metro-tiled shopfront leading to an ivy-adorned dining room adorned with wine bottles, creating a warm and convivial atmosphere.

sources.shortName: How to organize a romantic weekend in Bristol
Bristol’s Best Date Locations

places.name: littlefrench

reviews.text:
Little French has been on our list of restaurants to try, and superb delicacy is the only phrase which would describe our experience.

I have had similar cuisine from around the world, and Little French is nothing less than exceptional quality and refinement.

We cannot wait to explore more of their ever changing menu and encourage others to as well!

I've been trying to get back to littlefrench for sometime, so a business trip to Bristol gave the ideal excuse to stay on and visit for lunch.
The name provides a big clue as to the style of the menu and in practice it doesn't disappoint.
We started by sharing some crispy pigs ears, before moving on to radish with cod's roe (simple and tasty) and scallops (beautifully cooked with a delicious sauce).
For mains my partner had the lobster, which she says was pure bliss, whilst I had a fantastic flame grilled fillet,
Dessert was cherry and almond tart to die for.
There's an excellent range of interesting and reasonably priced wines by the glass and an extensive list if you are buying by the bottle.
I'm going to need to find another reason to visit  Bristol in the near future.

A fantastic dining experience tonight. Everything that we ate was absolutely delicious; the aligot was a star due to my love of garlic and cheese!

The service was brilliant - our host, Stella, was friendly and attentive and also felt like they were authentic to themselves as well. There's nothing better than when someone can let their personality shine through at work! A credit to the restaurant.

Will definitely be returning!

places.address: 2 North View, Westbury Park, Bristol BS6 7QB, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Located in the charming suburb of Clifton, England, Redgrave Theatre is a popular venue that showcases a diverse array of performances such as comedy, operas, dance, and theater. Despite its modest 315-seat capacity, the theater offers an intimate atmosphere with exceptional acoustics and views. Originally established by Clifton College in 1966 as Clifton College Theatre, it was later renamed after Sir Michael Redgrave.

sources.snippet: The Redgrave Theatre provides an intimate space for a variety of professional touring companies, comedians, film societies, music concerts and dance pieces. The Theatre also plays host to several Bristol Old Vic Theatre School productions each year.
sources.shortName: Best Bristol date ideas

sources.snippet: Going to Redgrave Theatre Bristol is also a great activity to do with your partner. The Redgrave Theatre is a great place where you can see live performances together. There is a variety of shows that you can find at this theater.
sources.shortName: 32 Romantic Things To Do in Bristol: Date Ideas in Bristol

places.name: Redgrave Theatre

reviews.text: Went here to see "Oh what a  night ". Very small theatre  but accommodated event perfectly. Sound and lighting were excellent! Staff all lovely and friendly. Due to size its mainly standing in lobby/bar area and  very few toilets 🚻. Best to pre-order your interval drinks so you have time to queue !

Friendly staff, but the seats are tiny with very little leg room.
Luckily I didn't have anyone in the seat beside me, otherwise I don't think I would have been able to fit (I'm only just over 6ft)  also it was exceptionally hot in there, according to a post by the artist the following day it was 39° in the theatre during show, ans it certainly felt like it. But those points aside, its a nice venue.

This is a small to medium sized venue. The auditorium is fine with cinema style tip-up seats and a sloped floor. However, the small bar area is also the waiting area, and until the auditorium opens, you'll be jostled in that tightly crammed space by punters seeking a drink or trying to reach the bogs. Anyway, you go for the entertainment. I've been twice, and both times I've been a little disappointed with my choice, but that's what happens when you're a grumpy old git.

places.address: Percival Rd, Clifton, Bristol BS8 3LE, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: The Old Bookshop, located on North Street in Bristol, is a unique and quirky pub offering a mix of German, Belgian & European-inspired beers paired with comfort food dishes. The venue boasts an eclectic interior filled with taxidermy, brass musical instruments, and odd canvas paintings. Recently renovated to include a dedicated cocktail bar run by Bristol's legendary Psycopomp, the place has become even more exciting.

sources.snippet: Cosy North Street bar The Old Bookshop is quirky and cosy, filled with random artifacts and interesting decor. Not only is it a romantic date location but it also boats a well stocked bar, with plenty of decent ales to choose from.
sources.shortName: The most romantic places in Bristol to take your date on Valentine's Day 2020
The most romantic places in Bristol to take your date…

places.name: LUPE Bar & Kitchen

reviews.text: One of the best Sunday roasts I've had! A plate full of vegetables, including Yorkshire pudding, good gravy, mini-potatoes and lots more. Three options for the roast plate, I chose the Wellington. I've also enjoyed the cheeseburger and chips. Very good beer selection, including local Deya and other regional beers, besides international ones. Almost all of the beers and ciders are vegan. A creative cocktail menu also. Pleasant service.

We came here today for the first time searching for a Sunday roast, we were welcomed by staff and taken to our table. Menu was simple, easy, and good veggie options. Food was everything I wanted, homy and delicious. There is obviously room for improvement, but for the price, it's worth it. The browie was pure perfection, definitely the best I had in a very long time. I will be a returning customer. Thank you for a kind, friendly, and joyful service.

It is so great to have this classic pub but vegan! Everything we hade were delicious. We tried the Sunday roast (on Sunday) and the fish and chips and hot sauce cauliflower (on Friday). Notice every day they have a different menu (depends on the day).

They have this great variety of beers, and the atmosphere is super fun. Can't recommend enough.

places.address: 63 & 65 North St, Bedminster, Bristol BS3 1ES, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Little Victories is a charming café located at Wapping Wharf in Bristol, known for its exceptional coffee roasted by Clifton Coffee Roasters. Despite its name, the café is not as small as one might expect and offers a variety of espresso drinks, filter coffees, soft drinks, cakes, and sandwiches. The café's light and airy ambiance with bleached-wood tables and high ceilings provides a perfect spot for people-watching.

sources.snippet: This is one of the most romantic things to do in Bristol if both you and your partner love coffee!. You can go to Little Victories together!. This is an espresso bar where you can have a delicious cup of coffee!
sources.shortName: 32 Romantic Things To Do in Bristol: Date Ideas in Bristol
Bristol’s Best Date Locations

places.name: Little Victories

reviews.text: I've been tasting hot chocolates around Bristol and this is one of my favourites - oat hot chocolate was lovely, creamy and tastes like it is made with real chocolate, would recommend!

Nice coffee, but I have been working my way around Bristol's coffee shops and I have had better. Still 100x better than a Nero/Starbucks/Costa though!
Toasted banana bread was nice.
Good atmosphere, and a great place to sit to work or watch the world go by.
Friendly service, efficient. Nice tables outside. Decent flat white and fab toasted banana bread…memories of Australia!

places.address: 7 Gaol Ferry Steps, Bristol, BS1 6WE, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: The Milk Thistle is a hidden gem located in a historic building that was once a meeting place for merchant venturers. This clandestine cocktail bar spans four floors and features oak paneling, stained glass, taxidermy creatures, and antique trinkets. To enter, guests must ring the doorbell and be escorted to a plush lounge with dim lighting. The bar offers creative cocktails served in tumblers or enamel mugs, such as the Bristol Tea and The Winchester.

sources.snippet: Hyde & Co’s sister venue, The Milk Thistle is much larger, but no less characterful. Spread across four floors, with a grand sweeping staircase and decadent and eclectic decor, the venue also houses a clandestine Whisky vault, which is available for private hire and tasting. For romantic things to do bristol, you can’t beat cosying up under candlelight in one of Milk Thistle’s comfy booths, or soaking up the city buzz on the outdoor terrace on warmer nights.
sources.shortName: Best Bristol date ideas

sources.snippet: The Milk Thistle was part of the UK Top 50 Cocktail bars for 2023, making it the perfect intimate, chic venue for Valentine’s Day. Spread over four stunning floors, including a relaxed lounge and bar, we recommend booking in advance to avoid disappointment. With fab staff, dark and mysterious interior, and cracking drinks with a regularly changing menu featuring classics as well as new creations, this is a great night time date spot.
sources.shortName: Bristol’s most romantic spots for Valentine’s Day

sources.snippet: Sister venue to Hyde & Co, the Milk Thistle has transformed the historic Quay Head House in the city centre to create a cocktail paradise spread over four magnificent levels. Similarly prohibition-themed and unmarked (as with Hyde & Co you’ll need to knock on the door to gain entry), there are plenty of nooks and crannies to hide away in with your loved one. Book ahead for the best tables.
sources.shortName: Bristol’s Hidden Gems: Romantic Bars

sources.snippet: The Milk Thistle is spread out across four glamorous floors, while The Granary Club is tucked away under a grand former grain warehouse in the centre. The Wellhead boasts some pretty views of the river and Castle Park, or you could visit Bristol’s very own gin boat: 6 O’clock Gin at The Glassboat.
sources.shortName: Romantic Places to Eat & Drink in Bristol

sources.snippet: Stop by for a nightcap at The Milk Thistle, a hidden gem in the heart of Bristol. This speakeasy-style bar offers an intimate atmosphere and a fantastic selection of cocktails. It’s the perfect place to toast to a wonderful weekend before heading back to The Bristol Wing.
sources.shortName: A Romantic (and Affordable) Weekend Getaway in Bristol

sources.snippet: Cocktails are a sure-fire way to make even the nicest date a little bit better. Speakeasy bar The Milk Thistle is the classiest of settings for creative drinks - it's definitely a place you won't forget in a hurry.
sources.shortName: The most romantic places in Bristol to take your date on Valentine's Day 2020
The most romantic places in Bristol to take your date…

sources.snippet: Housed over four floors in one of the finest historic buildings in the city, The Milk Thistle incorporates a cocktail bar, lounge & private function rooms.
sources.shortName: Romantic places to eat in Bristol

places.name: The Milk Thistle

reviews.text: Simply awesome. From entering the bar to the service and (of course) the drinks, The Milk Thistle wowed us all the way. My non-drinking partner raved about her custom non-alcoholic drink the team whipped up, calling it the 'best drink she ever had'. And my whisky-forward beverage, with mango beads (caviar) of all things... amazing. Definitely check it out if you're in the center of Bristol!

Cocktails were perfectly tasty but the service was slow. It was extremely dark as well so was hard to actually see your drinks/the menu! They also put in HUGE ice cubes so the quantity of drink is ridiculous for the price! Wouldn't recommend going as a bigger group as we were there for an hour and a half and only managed to get one drink served in that time! Was a ‘cool', ‘alternative' place to try out though!
Amazing bar tucked away in plain sight, press the button and enter a hidden cocktail world pure class from the surroundings and exceptional service. Hunt it down try ot you will love it!

places.address: Quay Head House, Colston Ave, Bristol BS1 1EB, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Under the Stars is a unique dining spot in Bristol, offering Mediterranean tapas on a boat moored in the historic harbour. The restaurant has been serving diners since 2010 and provides a cozy interior with rich wood and blue decor, as well as alfresco dining on the spacious top deck. Guests can enjoy delectable small plates and cocktails while taking in views of Bristol's Harbourside.

sources.snippet: Dine under the stars, upon the water, for this venue is a boat with an intimate top deck for al fresco dining. Moored up in Bristol harbourside, this is the most gorgeous venue with a Mediterranean tapas menu, perfect for sharing with your loved one. If it’s a bit chilly outside for your liking, the inside is cosy with a rich wood interior, perfect for snuggling up with a seasonal cocktail.
sources.shortName: Bristol’s most romantic spots for Valentine’s Day
