sources.snippet: Another venue on board a boat, Under The Stars offers great views across the harbour and serves up tapas dishes perfect for sharing. It's a small space which is just made for getting to know someone a little better in.
sources.shortName: The most romantic places in Bristol to take your date on Valentine's Day 2020
The most romantic places in Bristol to take your date…

places.name: Under the Stars

reviews.text: Amazing atmosphere. If you want somewhere to gossip over wine and bread and butter, this is the place to be. It is fairly overpriced, as in, I did expect the prices to reflect the gentrification of Bristol. The wine was good. Food was decent. All in all could not complain ☀️

What a fantastic venue.
Glad we booked ahead and had a great table sat outside in the evening sun.
Cocktails were good (on the pricier side) and they had a great wine selection which was good value for money.
Food was really nice, I especially enjoyed the crab croquetas.
Staff super friendly and the whole venue had a lovely welcoming atmosphere. Highly recommended

Visited the restaurant with a partner in the early evening. It is essentially a boat with a very cozy vibe to it. Unfortunately, it was a little chilly to sit on the outside section, but inside there's windows all facing the water where you can see ducks swimming by. The food tasted really good and the staff was welcoming, not only that but the portions of tapas are bigger than others I've visited which is a bonus. Would definitely recommend anyone to visit!

places.address: Narrow Quay, Bristol, BS1 4QA, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: The Gallimaufry is a popular and quirky wine bar and modern European restaurant located in Bishopston, Bristol. Since its opening in 2012, it has become a go-to spot for locals and visitors alike. The establishment exudes an artistic and eclectic vibe that perfectly complements the vibrant Gloucester Road area. With a commitment to featuring local beers from Bristol breweries alongside offerings from further afield, The Gallimaufry embraces independent and local flavors.

sources.snippet: Shake up your midweek date night with a trip to The Gallimaufry. A live music venue, the pub champions all things local, from its craft brews and interiors to its regular gigs showcasing promising fresh faces. It's even played host to the likes of George Ezra and Roo Pane before they made it big.
sources.shortName: Fun Things To Do For Couples In Bristol

sources.snippet: This Gloucester Road restaurant/bar has a beautifully-decorated ceiling, which in itself is enough to justify a trip there. The food and drink choices are really strong as well, if you fancy a romantic night centred on fine dining, and there's usually some high quality live music going on.
sources.shortName: The most romantic places in Bristol to take your date on Valentine's Day 2020
The most romantic places in Bristol to take your date…

sources.snippet: The perfect blend of chilled lounge barat the front and ambient dining at the back (with a chatty front terrace to boot) – there aren’t many things The Galli doesn’t excel at. Treat your date with a selection of their small plates and stick around for their nightly (and free) live music.
sources.shortName: Bristol’s Best Date Locations

sources.snippet: The Gallimaufry is an independent restaurant, bar, live music venue and arts space in the heart of Gloucester Rd, Bristol.
sources.shortName: Romantic places to eat in Bristol

places.name: The Gallimaufry

reviews.text:
Burgers were so good!
Dirty Fries were so good... You might want to share as portion was BIG!
Friendly, quick service.
Great atmosphere.
FULLY recommend!!

We came here on a Sunday afternoon for a roast after hearing a good recommendation from my friend who lives locally.

The inside was colourful with a unique decor. The staff were friendly and welcoming. My only complaint was that we ordered and it took a lengthy time for the food to arrive. However, the food was worth the wait as the generous portions were all delicious and cooked beautifully. The roast beef was one of the best I've ever had!

The roast dinner experience was not satisfactory. The pork belly served was a small slice, and the roast lamb was presented as shredded meat rather than the expected slices. This may indicate a focus on cost-cutting in food preparation. It's important to note that the food is provided by a pop-up caterer. On a positive note, the service from the Gallimaufry staff was commendable. Based on this experience, it may be wise to reconsider choosing this venue for a roast dinner.

places.address: 26-28 Gloucester Rd, Bishopston, Bristol BS7 8AL, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Hyde & Co is a low-lit, speakeasy-style bar located in The Triangle. Its cool and eclectic vibe, along with the doorbell entry, adds to the ambiance of a gentlemen's club. The bar offers an impressive range of cocktails, from light and delicate to robust flavor creations that pay homage to Bristol's drinking dens.

sources.snippet: Tucked away down a side street off Clifton Triangle (look for the bowler hat sign), prohibition-style bar, Hyde & Co.’s dimly-lit drinking den is inspired by the great cocktail bars of New York City. Serving up creative concoctions, it’s perfect for an atmospheric nightcap.
sources.shortName: Best Bristol date ideas
Romantic places to eat in Bristol
Bristol’s Best Date Locations

places.name: Hyde & Co

reviews.text: Finally had the pleasure to visit this place noted in my list. And I abs regret not being this exceptional cocktail bar so long! Each cocktail is masterpiece, both visually stunning and incredibly flavorful. Two bartenders here are artists, crafting creativity and inspiration and interesting ideas into their drinks. My friend and I are also love the decoration style. Cozy and warm. The time travel series is one you guys must try

Excellent venue, loved the decor. The only let down was the service! We sat in this cool little room and felt as if we were forgotten all night - we kept having to flag down the servers. Shame because it was a cool place with nice cocktails.

A great night and such an amazing ambiance. The cocktails are good, the menu is a journey in and of itself. It will definitely dent the wallet though but totally worth it. Would absolutely recommend for a mellow and memorable night out.

places.address: The Basement, 2 Upper Byron Pl, Bristol BS8 1JY, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: The Clockwork Rose is a steampunk-themed cocktail bar in Bristol, inspired by the fictional drinkery of adventurer Captain Sebastian Commodore. The bar offers a unique experience with handcrafted cocktails based on the tales of Captain Commodore and his crew. The ambiance is cozy and vibrant, making it an ideal spot for socializing or post-work drinks. Located near Bristol City Centre, this fantasy-focused bar also offers private hire and tasting masterclasses for special occasions.

sources.snippet: Themed around the fictional adventures of Captain Sebastian Commodore and his airshop, The Clockwork Rose is a steampunk-inspired cocktail bar that oozes quirk and romance. Drinks are derived from the Commodore’s tales – expect ingredients to include the likes of Tooth of an Algolian Tiger and Fallian Marsh Gas…
sources.shortName: Best Bristol date ideas

sources.snippet: Brozen Bar serve up frozen cocktails made to order with liquid nitrogen, while The Clockwork Rose has a steampunk theme for both its decor and cocktail menu.
sources.shortName: Romantic Places to Eat & Drink in Bristol

places.name: The Clockwork Rose

reviews.text: our favourite cocktail bar in bristol (or even in the world). phenomenal cocktails and lovely people. just want to share some pictures from the past 2 years here. the captain's table was an outstanding experience. thank you kit & danny

I really, really wanted to give this place five stars, but I just can't. We got a really friendly and welcoming greeting, the decor is just amazing, and combined with the music and drinks selection, it has a great speakeasy vibe that's like stepping back in time. When we visited during a quiet afternoon we thoroughly enjoyed our cocktails and chatting to the bartender. However, when we returned on a busy Friday night, it was a bit of a different experience. The two guys working werr clearly doing their best but really need another member of staff to serve customers. After finishing our drinks we were left waiting 45 minutes before we could order another one - and customers who had arrived looked to be waiting a similar amount of time to receive their drinks. This is just far too long and led to understandable frustration. It's a shame, as the staff are lovely and the cocktails are sublime - some really imaginative and special combinations that we thoroughly enjoyed! It's just let down a bit by the exceedingly slow service when busy. I think we'd go back, but perhaps not on a weekend night.

We were passing and it looked really interesting. Very cool 50-70's style lounge. Nice interesting menu of cocktails and with quite advanced mixing of cocktails.  The cocktail I had was a lovely complex flavours and nice to feel some love of the drink made.  It's a classy dark and relaxed style bar. (amazing pecan nuts). .

places.address: 16 St Stephen's St, Bristol, BS1 1JR, United Kingdom
